title: 107_hr3312
content: The "RAFT (Restore Access to Foreign Trade) Act" eliminates foreign base company shipping income as foreign base company income. The "RAFT Act" eliminates foreign base company shipping income under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including related definitions and provisions. The "RAFT Act" eliminates foreign base company shipping income under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including related definitions and provisions. It includes income from the use of aircraft or vessel in foreign commerce, services related to their use, and the sale of such aircraft or vessel. The term "shipping income" includes dividends, interest, and gains from the sale of stock or obligations of a foreign corporation related to shipping income, as well as income from partnerships and space or ocean activities. The term "shipping income" encompasses various sources of income related to space or ocean activities, excluding certain types of dividend, interest, and financial services income. Amendments are made to specific sections of the Code to reflect these changes. Amendments are made to Section 954 of the Code, including changes to subsections (b)(3) and (e), redesignating paragraphs, and striking and inserting specific references within the subsections. The amendments made to Section 954 of the Code include redesignating subsections (g), (h), and (i) as subsections (f), (g), and (h) respectively. These changes apply to taxable years of foreign corporations starting after December 31, 2001, and to taxable years of United States shareholders within which or with which those foreign corporations' taxable years end.
